intro: Lasiandra benthamiana, commonly known as the slender rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing a range of morphological features that aid in water conservation. Lasiandra benthamiana is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
